CytoDefiningCriteria: Perirhinal cortex in the rat can be distinguished from nearby cortices by several criteria.  Compared to insular cortex
it is bilaminate.  Differentiaion of insular cortex from area 36 is more problemmatic

although area 36 is characterized by cell sparse gaps betwen layers III and V.  The ventral border is formed by the entorhinal cortex which is characterized by medium to large darkly stained stellate cells organized in clusters
ChemoDefiningCriteria: Stains darkly for Timm's sulphide silver technique compared to entorhinal cortex
Perirhinal cortex of rodent of Burwell e.Definition: Cortical region surrounding the posterior rhinal sulcus in the rat, encompassing areas 35 and 36 in the rat.  Rostraly, it abuts the posterior insular cortex
